quote.text: I cannot call somebody ‘hard-working’ knowing only that they read and write. Even if ‘all night long’ is added, I cannot say it – not until I know the focus of all this energy.
quote.author: Epictetus
quote.aiInsight:
• Parenthood
    • Recognize that teaching children isn’t just about imparting basic skills—it's about guiding them to channel their energy with purpose. Just as reading and writing alone do not define hard work, foundational skills must be paired with meaningful direction.
    • Encourage your children to discover the “why” behind their efforts, helping them to understand that true diligence comes from focusing on what truly matters, rather than just accumulating activity.
  • Leadership
    • A leader's role is not merely to observe diligence in tasks, but to ensure that the energy and efforts of the team are purposefully directed toward common goals. It’s about making sure that hard work is effectively aligned with the overall vision.
    • Focus on coaching and strategy; when you see effort, ask yourself if it contributes meaningfully. This awareness drives better decision-making and sets a standard for purposeful action within your organization.
  • Product Management
    • In product management, it’s vital to differentiate between busywork and impactful work. Assess efforts not just by their duration or intensity, but by how strategically they move the product towards its vision.
    • Ensure that every feature, sprint, or task is backed by a clear rationale. This focus on purposeful energy allocation enhances both team efficiency and the overall success of the product.
